snippet: Anthony D. Weiner’s rivals debated the seriousness of his potential candidacy and its impact on their own place in a large and unsettled field.
abstract: Anthony D Weiner says he may enter New York City mayoral race, causing stir that highlights lingering potency of his reputation even after scandal ended his career as Democratic congressman in 2011; would-be rivals debate seriousness of his potential candidacy and its impact on their own place in a large and unsettled field.

byline.contributor: David W. Chen, Stephen Farrell and Michael M. Grynbaum contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Anthony D. Weiner’s rivals debated the seriousness of his potential candidacy and its impact on their own place in a large and unsettled field.

headline.seo: Would-Be Rivals Weigh Effect of a Weiner Run for Mayor
headline.main: Weiner Jolts Mayor’s Race by Saying He May Enter It
headline.print_headline: Weiner Jolts Mayor’s Race By Saying He May Enter It
